item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (1055 points | 1931 comments)
2. Lenovo has removed its iconic TrackPoint nub from new ThinkPad laptops (32 points | 35 comments)
3. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (37 points | 15 comments)
4. The Fuzzing Book (41 points | 2 comments)
5. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (250 points | 188 comments)
6. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
7. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (116 points | 2 comments)
8. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (156 points | 101 comments)
9. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (79 points | 23 comments)
10. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (209 points | 127 comments)
11. VS Code Pets (454 points | 120 comments)
12. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (22 points | 4 comments)
13. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (188 points | 34 comments)
14. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (72 points | 25 comments)
15. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (90 points | 10 comments)
16. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (121 points | 52 comments)
17. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (483 points | 186 comments)
18. What Roman Coins Reveal About the People Who Made Them (9 points | discuss)
19. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (96 points | 64 comments)
20. Calculator Forensics (2002) (3 points | discuss)
21. A System for the Sixties-and-a-Half: The Toshiba Visicom COM-100 (16 points | 1 comment)
22. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (198 points | 99 comments)
23. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (99 points | 26 comments)
24. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (93 points | 140 comments)
25. Volkswagen Sausage and the Enduring Appeal of Culinary Car-Industry Crossovers (12 points | 8 comments)
26. Why do bees die when they sting you? (2021) (320 points | 224 comments)
27. Open Dylan (35 points | 8 comments)
28. Reverse Engineering a VanMoof E-Shifter – Part 2 – Decoding the Signals (32 points | 17 comments)
29. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (252 points | 66 comments)
30. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (80 points | 18 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
